page.title: 10Wooler Common
page.content: To the west of Wooler the land is quite hilly as you go towards Cheviot. The moorland is used for a mixture of sheep farming and forestry.In 1980,200 acres of moorland and rough grazing were planted with trees by the Forest- ry Commission.The programme for the 80's is to plant 25 species of trees- 12 species of hardwood and 15 species of softwood.Groups of hardwood will be planted aound the forest area and the infill will be with softwood.Suitable areas for wildlife will be established away from picnic places.There will be forest walks,ponds and car parking facilities. . Wooler Common already has picnic areas and two pond areas are now well established.It is a popular place for walking,particularly at the week-ends.
